SEARCH
Package koopa.cobol

Class CobolFiles

java.lang.Object
koopa.cobol.CobolFiles
public class CobolFiles extends Object
This class offers a number of utility functions which help in selecting Cobol source files and copybooks. You can basically ask it whether a file is a Cobol file, and it will test for this by checking the file's extension against a number of known extensions (ignoring case).

In addition you can ask this class for FileFilter and FilenameFilter instances which will fall back on the same logic.

So what extensions are covered ? Well, by default you get these:

  • For source files: CBL and COB.
  • For copybooks: CPY and COPY.

These defaults can be modified by passing a comma separated list of extensions to one of the following system properties:

  • koopa.cobol.sources; for identifying source files
  • koopa.cobol.copybooks; for identifying copybooks
So, for example, -Dkoopa.cobol.sources=cbl,cob -Dkoopa.cobol.copybooks=cpy,copy is equivalent to the default.

By setting your own extensions for any category, the defaults for that category will not be set. So setting -Dkoopa.cobol.sources=cbl -Dkoopa.cobol.copybooks=cob means that only files with extension 'cbl' will be seen as source files, and only files with extension 'cob' will be seen as copybooks.

    • configure

      public static void configure()
      Reconfigure the extension support. This allows you to override the different system properties in code and make sure they get used.

    • addSourceExtensions

      private static void addSourceExtensions(String extraSourceExtensions)

    • setSourceExtensions

      public static void setSourceExtensions(String[] extensions)
      This sets the list of source extensions to match those provided.

      If one of the new extensions is found in the list of copybook extensions it will be removed from that one.

    • setCopybookExtensions

      public static void setCopybookExtensions(String[] extensions)
      This sets the list of copybook extensions to match those provided.

      If one of the new extensions is found in the list of source extensions it will be removed from that one.
